title: London derbies
text:
London Derbies are the various <a href="local%20derby">local</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> derbies between the teams in <a href="London">London</a>, <a href="England">England</a>. It specifically refers to individual matches between the teams, but can also be used to describe the general ongoing rivalry between the clubs and <a href="Football%20hooliganism">fans</a>. The first London <a href="English%20Football%20League">Football League</a> derby took place at <a href="Clapton%20Stadium">Clapton Stadium</a> on 11 November 1905, where <a href="Chelsea%20F.C.">Chelsea</a> beat <a href="Leyton%20Orient%20F.C.">Clapton Orient</a> 3–0 in a <a href="Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Second Division</a> match. Chelsea also won the first top-flight London derby with a 2–1 victory over <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Woolwich Arsenal</a>, in a <a href="Football%20League%20First%20Division">First Division</a> game at <a href="Stamford%20Bridge%20%28stadium%29">Stamford Bridge</a> on 9 November 1907. As of the <a href="2021%E2%80%9322%20in%20English%20football">2021–22 season</a>, there are thirteen clubs in the <a href="Premier%20League">Premier League</a> and <a href="The%20Football%20League">Football League</a> that play in the <a href="Greater%20London">Greater London</a> area. <a href="North%20London%20derby">Arsenal against Tottenham Hotspur</a> and <a href="Millwall%20F.C.%E2%80%93West%20Ham%20United%20F.C.%20rivalry">Millwall against West Ham United</a> are ranked as two of the most ferocious London derbies.
Clubs in London.
<a href="List%20of%20former%20English%20Football%20League%20clubs">Defunct English Football League clubs</a> based in London include <a href="Thames%20A.F.C.">Thames</a> and <a href="Wimbledon%20F.C.">Wimbledon</a>.
